statement:
Every finite group $G$ has a filtration
$$G \supset G_0 \supset \cdots \supset G_n = \{1\},$$ where each
$G_{i+1}$ is normal in $G_i$ and each quotient group $G_i/G_{i+1}$ is a
simple group. Any two such decompositions of $G$ have the same multiset
of simple groups $G_i/G_{i+1}$ up to ordering.

A filtration of $G$ satisfying the properties above is called a
[*Jordan–Hölder decomposition*]{} of $G$.
